title: Add public Biodata page and navigation links

requirements.summary: Create a new public /biodata route that renders an English page heading "Biodata".
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to /biodata renders a public page without requiring authentication.
The page displays a visible heading with the exact text "Biodata".

file_operations.description: Create the BiodataPage component that renders a public page with a visible H1 heading text exactly "Biodata".
Register and wire the new /biodata route into the TanStack Router route tree so it is publicly accessible (no RoleGate/auth requirement).

requirements.summary: Render Professional Summary and Core Competencies sections on /biodata using the provided text and bullets.
acceptanceCriteria: The page shows a section title "Professional Summary" followed by the provided summary text (English).
The page shows a section title "Core Competencies" followed by four bullet points corresponding to: Classical Mastery, Versatile Instruction, Global Teaching, and Choreography.
No placeholder or gallery-related content appears on the /biodata page.

file_operations.description: Add two content sections: (1) "Professional Summary" with the provided paragraph, and (2) "Core Competencies" with a bulleted list of the four provided competency items; ensure no placeholder/gallery content is rendered.

requirements.summary: Add header (desktop + mobile) and footer navigation links to /biodata labeled "Biodata".
acceptanceCriteria: The header desktop navigation includes a link labeled "Biodata" that navigates to /biodata.
The header mobile navigation includes a link labeled "Biodata" that navigates to /biodata and closes the mobile menu on click.
The footer includes a link labeled "Biodata" that navigates to /biodata.

file_operations.description: Add a desktop navigation Link labeled "Biodata" pointing to /biodata, and add a mobile navigation Link labeled "Biodata" pointing to /biodata that closes the mobile menu on click (setMobileMenuOpen(false)).
Add a footer site link labeled "Biodata" pointing to /biodata alongside the existing public links.
